title.value: Inferring electric vehicle charging patterns from smart meter data for impact studies
title.justification: The title was taken directly from the header section of the paper as it clearly states the main focus and methodology utilized in the research: inferring electric vehicle charging patterns from smart meter data.
title.quote: Inferring electric vehicle charging patterns from smart meter data for impact studies

extractions.description: The paper proposes a non-intrusive and training-free method to detect behind-the-meter electric vehicle charging events using data from smart meters. The approach does not rely on supervised or unsupervised learning and avoids the need for labeled training data, making it valuable for utility companies in understanding and predicting EV charging patterns. The method is compared with other learning-based approaches for accuracy in a case study using real smart meter data.

type.justification: The paper presents an empirical study as it involves the application of a proposed method to real-world smart meter data to detect EV charging patterns. This is evidenced by the usage of terms like 'numerical case study' and 'demonstrate accuracy', indicating experimental validation.
type.quote: In a numerical case study, we use the proposed approach to extract EV charging events from a test dataset of customers’ meter data, and we demonstrate that similar detection accuracy is achieved as that of other learning-based approaches.

name.justification: The research primarily revolves around detecting electric vehicle charging events and inferring charging patterns using smart meter data, which aligns well with the field of Electric Vehicle Charging Detection.
name.quote: We develop a method that can accurately detect the EV charging events from smart meter data through a mixed-integer convex program, which can be solved in a computationally efficient way.

name.justification: The research utilizes advanced metering infrastructure, such as smart meters, which is a key component of smart grid technologies.
name.quote: By leveraging the contextual information of EV charging, we formulate a mixed-integer convex quadratic program (MICQP) to detect EV charging events from customers’ daily meter data.

name.justification: The paper involves recognizing and analyzing patterns of energy consumption for electric vehicle charging, which fits within the domain of energy consumption pattern recognition.
name.quote: In a numerical case study, we use the proposed approach to extract EV charging events from a test dataset of customers’ meter data, and we demonstrate that similar detection accuracy is achieved as that of other learning-based approaches.

name.justification: The paper mentions the use of convolutional neural networks as a benchmark for comparison with the proposed method, which focuses on a non-learning-based approach.
name.quote: Supervised machine learning methods, e.g., convolutional neural networks and recurrent neural networks.

is_contributed.justification: The CNN model is utilized for benchmarking the proposed method, not developed or contributed by this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We compare it with two other algorithms: one based on signal decomposition and the other using a trained CNN model.

is_executed.justification: The CNN was referenced for benchmarking purposes; there is no indication it was executed as part of this study's experiments.
is_executed.quote: We compare the estimated PMFs and the cumulative distribution functions (CDFs, except for the charger power levels) computed from the detection results with those from the ground truth.

is_compared.justification: The CNN model was indeed compared in terms of accuracy with the proposed method, emphasizing the achieved results without using high-resolution data or training.
is_compared.quote: To benchmark the performance of our proposed approach to detect the EV charging events, we compare it with two other algorithms: one based on signal decomposition and the other using a trained CNN model.

referenced_paper_title.value: An event-driven convolutional neural architecture for non-intrusive load monitoring of residential appliance
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the reference from which the CNN model used for comparison in the study was derived.
referenced_paper_title.quote: D. Yang, X. Gao, L. Kong, Y. Pang, B. Zhou, An event-driven convolutional neural architecture for non-intrusive load monitoring of residential appliance.

name.justification: The Pecan Street dataset was explicitly used in the research to test and validate the proposed approach for detecting EV charging events from smart meter data.
name.quote: We use the Pecan Street data to evaluate the performance of our method to extract customers’ EV charging habits.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The Pecan Street dataset was provided by Pecan Street's Dataport, as indicated in the reference.
referenced_paper_title.quote: P.S. Dataport, 2022, http://dataport.pecanstreet.org, (Last Accessed on 25 April 2022).
